38618301.review:
Would the helpful math underlying this game be group theory? Graph theory?

Whatever it is, KNIGHTS is a rare type of puzzle game: it doesn't involve any numbers (unlike in the Hexcells, SquareCells, and CrossCells, and Cross Set games), and each puzzle doesn't involve discrete solvable subparts and doesn't really introduce any new gameplay mechanics as you progress (unlike in say, Hook, Zenge, PUSH, and klocki). 

Rather, you play by moving around the finite permutations of a set of chess knights on a small playing board to achieve a desired configuration; the mechanics are simple enough to grasp with a glance. This ends up making the game more difficult in a way, especially by the later levels, but it's a pure, fair, and classic sort of difficulty.

The general aesthetic, which includes graphic+UI design and music, is as pleasant and relaxing as any other minimalist puzzle game. The puzzles are short and sweet enough to play in a few convenient minutes of your time, and there is enough pure difficulty from the way the game is designed so as to never really be reduced into a few algorithmic strategies. 

You can also unlock a rather difficult Daily Levels pack after you finish the game too, so the game does have its replay value.

All in all, a solid puzzle game. Would definitely recommend.

36538309.review:
[h1]Simple, clean, challenging.[/h1]

KNIGHTS has a very simple core concept but the learning curve (although nice) can be challenging. So challenging in fact that I tried to binge-play the game and ended up getting frustrated and putting it down for weeks. 

When I picked up the game again, I approached it differently: I would only play it while in a fresh state of mind and I would play in moderation. It was working well. One time though, I got carried away by the achievement progression - I was tired and my play session was already overextended - and I ended up using a guide for 2 stages from the Queen pack. But I noticed and corrected this behavior and went back to my previously stated guidelines: "Mental clarity + moderation". I replayed these 2 stages and carried on. 

By the end of the King Pack I had noticed a clear, progressive improvement in my ability to visualize moves and manipulate the pieces to reach the goals. And now here I am, with the game 100% done, satisfied with it and feeling accomplished.

GG

I've been playing Knights every now and then, mainly because it's (to me at least) an extremely difficult puzzle game. I think that I played it offline for 50 hours, Idk XD
It's basically based on chess, although you have only knights as the title says and you've got to place them on the checkboard; red knights on red tiles, blue on blue, and then you'll encounter more and more useless golden knights.. the difficulty level is perfect but greatly increases with time! You'll have blocked grey tiles of course, to add even more difficulty :P
You actually don't have to even know how to play chess, since this game is mostly based on logic and/or trying for thousand times - hence if you look only at the difficult/largest levels, it won't be relaxing at all (the developers said that it's relaxing but trust me, it can be a lot frustrating and thanks God to Youtube guides ahah).
Ayways, since the knight can move only in an L-shaped way, it's great that the developers managed to make such an interesting minimalistic game with so few things on their hands - knights, tiles, and squares!
It's completely recommended, but only to those who are into puzzle and logic games (not chess, as I said :) ) 'cos otherwise it can be really frustrating and boring - after all, it's just increasing difficulty and putting other pieces in the same checkboards.
Very easy to play in any case, and runs smoothly. Good!

35096059.review:
[h1]Verdict:[/h1]
I'm not going to question why you're looking at reviews for a 0.99 game. But this should be one of the last ones you read. After this paragraph or so of text, you're going to scroll upwards, buy this game, and enjoy your life. 

Just do it.

[h1]What is this thing you call a "Chess"?[/h1]
KNIGHTS is a game about, you guessed it, moving knight pieces on little checkered puzzle boards. Do you need to know jack about chess? Not really, but it helps if you've played a few casual games, just so you're familiar with a Knight's moves, since it's definitely the least intuitive of the pieces. But, even if you've never played a game of chess in your life, this game indicates quite clearly which spaces you can and can't move to.

[h1]But is it any good though?[/h1]
KNIGHTS takes the mechanics of moving a knight chess piece, and builds a fantastic little puzzler around it. Your task is to move knights to certain preallocated positions, which gradually becomes more and more complex as your chessboard shrinks, and the number of pieces increases. You can do this by just brute-force clicking at everything you can until it works, which is only viable for the earlier puzzles, or carefully try to map out how you want things to look like X moves from now, and work backwards. At the point I'm at, about 2 hours in, I'd go crazy if I even attempted to brute-force these monsters...

The game also apparently has dailies, which I haven't looked at too much so far. These might have varying difficulties day to day (the was Duet does it), or  just a set difficulty. I'll update this review on my thoughts on dailies once I give them a look. At a glance, though, just that should be enough to add a good number of hours to your time with this game.

[h1]What can you even buy with a dollar anymore in America?[/h1]
Really, it's just a fun and cue little puzzle game for a dollar. Literally a buck.  Just skip on your next coffee flavor/espresso-shot, and you'll be good to go.

34094104.review: Knights is a simple relaxing puzzler based on the classic movement of the Knight chess piece. Designated pieces must be moved about the board methodically to their matching colored spaces. There are several puzzle packs which ramp up in size and difficulty, as well as the ability to unlock daily procedurally generated levels as you progress through the game. The puzzles are all logically solvable, and in the King pack in particular, random movements to attempt a solve will generally not yield the desired fruit. As the game is based upon a single concept I found it easier to play in short bursts, rather than try to solve 100+ similar puzzles one after another. My only complaint is that of a sore neck as I found myself inadvertantly angling my head 45 degrees to give a more traditional perspective of the puzzle board.

33937184.review:
As the name suggests, this is a classic "moving pieces" puzzle game. The base mechanic is incredibly simple and easy to pick up. But make no mistake - this is not a casual puzzle game where you can mindlessly brute-force yourself to victory - the chess-style movement means you can easily find yourself trapped in a loop. Once you've gotten over the initial confusion, patterns start to emerge. With a little planning, careful thought and clever management of your empty spaces you'll still find success rather easily.

The 82 pre-made levels are pretty much an optimal length. They provide a nice progression and never really feel boring. The game also features an endless mode in the form of randomly generated daily levels (75 of them each day), although I wasn't blown away by them. Even though they variy widly in difficulty, they feel very samey and tiresome as they are always on 5x5 grids and have 2 or 3 spaces empty. I would have liked customisation for difficulty, grid size and difficulty (empty tiles). But this is a very minor gripe as the price-tag leaves nothing to be desired. You get a [b]lot[/b] of bang for your buck, even at full retail price. My playtime of 7-8 hours includes beating the game, around 30 daily levels and getting all the achievements.

The game is technically solid. It has a pleasant and consistent style in terms of visuals and sound, sometimes even a little too much style. The initial load time feels long and the fade-out upon closing the game is pretty annoying. I would have also liked to see a separate volume control for sound effects and music and at least "Escape" bound as a keyboard shortcut (there are none).

I like puzzle games and Steam has been recommending this to me for a while. I'm not much of a chess player so I never really put a lot of thought into it. Even though it is somewhat of a one-trick pony, I was very pleasantly surprised and can wholeheartedly recommend this game, even at full price!

33594608.review:
Reminder, if you don't like chess or minimalistic puzzle games... this game won't be for you. I happen to like these types of games so that first part didn't apply to me. If this disclaimer doesn't apply to you then feel free to read onwards!

Wow! What a fantastic game! I absolutely loved this game for the idea of the game and how well it was executed. I've got a lot more to say about it, but I'll run through a list of the pros and cons of the game first.

Pros:
- Low Price 
For only 1 dollar off sale and even less when it’s on sale, this game is quite worth it! Imo it could be a little bit more on the shop and I still would have bought it!
- Fantastic Idea
I've loved the puzzles that deal with the knight piece from Chess for the longest time, but the idea of putting a bunch of them on a chessboard and then working puzzles around them was also awesome. It was especially rewarding that one of the achievements led to you thinking a little bit outside the box on a certain level as well.
- Infinite replaying
Even though I'm not really sure how it works, it seems that there are 75 new puzzles generated for the game for each different day! I didn't play through a whole bunch of them but I did notice the changes between the different days, and (bonus!) the puzzles are still quite challenging.
- Colorblind mode
I feel that a lot of games of this type don't give too much thought to the colorblind players of the game, but I really enjoy that this dev took the time to make a separate colour palette so that everyone could enjoy the game.

Cons:
- Lack of "saving"
The only real problem that I had with this game is that there wasn't any way to save the progress that you made with a given level. It was a little bit annoying knowing that if you started a level you were stuck there and had to finish it up before you could step away again (otherwise you'd lose all progress).

Overall, I'd say the execution, idea, and time that were put into making this game make it a fantastic buy and the low price makes it that much better in the end. If you can get it on sale, that's cool but it's worth it even if it isn't! Overall, a solid 9.5/10 and like I said if there was "save mechanic" this game would have gotten a 10/10 from me!

even though I'm not into chess, I had a good time playing knights. there's not much to it, you can only move the pieces like you would if you were playing chess, but you only have different colored knights here that you have to move around until they end up where they should be, blue ones on a square with a blue silhouette, red ones on a red. yellow figures are just there to cause you pain and block your movement but they can also be moved around.

I recommend checking out the game even if you don't like chess, like myself. at this price you can't really go wrong with it if you enjoy puzzle games.

30749837.review:
Oh. My. God.   I just finished Knights, and my brain hurts. It really does.   I don't get much time to play games, so I have to cram everything at the weekend.   Thinking in "L" shaped patterns, and working out chains of moves is NOT my forte!  Let's just get it out there: I suck at chess.  I really do.  I once put a chess computer on "zero ply" (which is AI-speak for 'don't be clever, just move random pieces to places they can go), and I still didn't manage to win.  

So, a game which is all about trying to put pieces in a specific location is supremely brain-busting for me.    Nevertheless, I persevered through, and managed to finish the main game.   

The game is split into five 'levels', and each level has between 9 and 30 'boards'.. Each board is set up so that you have to move knight chess pieces around in order to put the red or blue knights back onto their red or blue squares.   Sounds easy?  Well, to begin with,  it is :)  

Pretty soon, bit of the board become un-usable, and then there are yellow knights whose sole purpose is to get in the way.   Once the little yellow b*****ds turn up, the game starts to turn into a really brain-bending challenge, because you often have to move a bunch of yellows out of the way, in a specific chain in order to get your coloured knight into the right spot.

As the game continues, you start to 'see' patterns.  There are ways to get your knight from one spot to another spot at a relative position away.  There are some hard moves (moving immediately next door) and easy ones (moving two squares away, or to your diagonal neighbour )..   Once you start to see the patterns, the game starts to flow a little better, and all of a sudden you begin to 'see' the chains of moves you need to make, and before long you're planning ahead to get the knight where you want it to be.   I guess it's sort of like a kingergarten level sense of 'ply' that real chess players have when they can scan the board, and plot a number of moves in advance.

However, chess masters can simulate the moves in their heads, which normos like me can't so the game really helps by allowing you to 'see' the valid target jumps for a knight by clicking on it, and doing chains is easy because you can just keep clicking the place you want to move it to.  moving back and forth incurs no penalties, so you can move things about all over the place.    One of the most frustrating things is that the boards can be set up so that specific knights have to be in place before you tackle others.  It's vitally important in the later levels that you nail those first, or you're just going to spin for ages, moving one piece all over the shop.

I'd say my experience to begin with was very impressed by the way you could 'milk' a game out of one chess piece.  This turned into being impressed by the way the board managed to be set up in increasing ways.  This turned into being impressed by how the boards are set up beautifully, but are, indeed, solvable, when they REALLY shouldn't be.   This then turned into dogged determinism to get the darned game finished.   Yes, I have to admit, midway through the 'queen' level, I started to really struggle.  I'd say the estimated time to complete a board started out at about 10 seconds, and midway through 'queen' ended up being a solid 10 to 15 minutes.   Strangely,  by the end of queen, I'd really started to get back into whatever flow you need, and the king level was relatively easy compared to queen.

Once you get to (say) Queen level, you are well-enough armed to tackle the Daily puzzles.  Like Lyne, Race the sun,  and a few other indie puzzlers, the daily puzzles are all procedurally generated.  The first one I tried was solved in two clicks.  The next one had be beat.  The difficulty level is all over the place, because the computer doesn't know what makes a level hard for a human.  What's really impressive is that the designers have figured out how to make boards procedurally generate that are still solvable!

I really enjoyed this game, and despite my frustration in 'queen', I think it's well worth a play if you like logic and puzzle problems:  Especially if you like chess, or just like indie puzzlers like Lyne.

30155354.review:
Sory of a sliding square type puzzle (move to the open space), but with a good feel (unlike typical sliding square type puzzle games, which I really despise as generally boring and fustrating). Very nice mechanics and interface. A mechanic that is just different enough to be pleasingly unique, but not weird, if you see what I mean: All of us who do puzzles all familiar with the knight move and the sliding square concept, but they feel surprisingly fresh here.

Also, there is no "do this in the minimum number of moves or it does not really 'count' as a win" type mechanic. There is no counter. This gives it the feel of a physical puzzle that you can feel free to fiddle with until you get it. You do not get stuck after almost getting it and have to start over. For me, this makes it perfect -- fun, not work.

If you like puzzle games at all, this is one you really should get.

29342496.review:
For 51 cents (on sale) you get an everlasting puzzle game.  Usually with cheap puzzle games they are short and once you finish them there is no replayablity factor.  Here, with the addition of daily puzzles - 3  new sets of 25 boards/levels every day, it's unending and you certainly get your money's worth out of it.  In main game, there are 5 sets of puzzles, each set of varying amount - 82 boards in total.  The first 3 sets are very easy. 

If you don't random click your way through the easy beginning sets but make sure you work it out, then it will greatly help you with the King and daily levels and get you used to patterns.  This puzzle game has nothing to do with chess (apart from how the knight moves) but I would say you do have to be able to think ahead at least 2-3 moves - actually backward from the solution.

It's a pick it up just do one board type game which is great but I wish you could save mid way through a board.  I did find most dailies to be a bit harder than the King pack.  For achievement hunters, wanting the quickest/easiest route - some daily level tips -

- Don't even try and do a daily pack, know you are going to play this over a few days.
- Some days just seem quite a bit easier than others.
- On each day in each of 3 pack I found 3-5 boards that were about King level.
- Sometimes A1 etc boards are the easiest but not always.
- Only play boards that have 3 spare spaces in them - ignore the two space ones, I found having  space to move around easier.

If you love work it out puzzles, no timer just point n click then I do recommend this really fun game.  I loved it.

29165680.review:
The game Knights is a very relaxing, but a game that needs focus. The game is very good for its style and its puzzles. The game also has a lot of replay value.

Knights is in a chess style, with the only pieces being knights that you move, this style is accompanied by a chessboard that the pieces lay on. The knights thus move in the same way they do in chess, this is a very good game mechanic, as it gives you something you are familier with, such as a chess knight, and making you use it differently, as in these puzzles. This use of only the knight is interesting, as it is the only piece in chess that can jump over blocked pieces, as it moves the strangest out of all the pieces, thus giving it a special interest.

The puzzles in Knights are very fun, and challenging, you have to move the red knights into the red spaces, and the blue knights into the blue spaces, which is easy at first, but it ends up getting challenging quickley (as this is a bloody video game!), and you need to find new ways to move pieces around to achieve the end goal. Eventually more obstcles are introduced, such as blocked spaces, and outcast knights (with no space to go, so they end up getting in the way).

Knights has a system that is not unlike Lyne's, where you unlock daily puzzles. These daily puzzles help to provide much more replay value. If you finish the main puzzles, you can just play the daily puzzles. The only problem I have encountered with the daily puzzles thus far is that, because they are randomly generated, they will sometimes be generated solved. I am unaware if I have come across an impossible puzzle, as it's hard to tell if my failure is from a lack of skill or the lack of solvability. A massive pro to having daily puzzles is if a puzzle is too hard, you can always wait till tomorrow to get a puzzle matching your skill level, and you are not unable to progress.

Overall Knights is a very well made game, if you enjoy puzzle games like Lyne, Knights is a great choice, or even if you love a game of chess, Knights will be a familier friend. The puzzles are quite addictive, once you get the hang of it, and the daily puzzles give you a reason to not uninstall it after completing.

The game delves into numerous possibilities of positioning your piece and making "the right move", as highlighted by where you should put the coloured Knight in its corresponding tile. The only one chess piece featured, The Knight, quite obviously, is secretly a brilliant concept to improve one's ability to perform in an average game of chess.

The game specializes in providing the perspective of the game limited to only the Knight, meaning you are able to narrow down your opportunities in taking out another player's piece by considering the move limitations and potential of your Knights you are playing. 

Moreover, I would like to commend the creative input they put in the interface. Using not only simple buttons to navigate a player but also provide content that is straight to the point and adds to an overall polished product.

[h1]About KNIGHTS[/h1]
KNIGHTS is a minimalist puzzle game based on a single chess piece, the titular knight. A simple enough to pick up and relaxing experience.
A nice simple puzzle game. Building on basic chess problems like the knights tour, but adding more elements into the mix, such as squares you can't land on, target goals and multiple knights instead of just trying to cover all the squares on a board.
Note that you don't need to have any chess knowledge to play, just know that knights move in an L shape.
I did find at times I came to the solution after randomly moving pieces around, but most of the time the levels do require you to think it through.

All in All [u]KNIGHTS[/u] is a really nice Puzzle Game!

28930023.review:
Gameplay:

How to play the game:
Very simple, anyone who's ever liked playing chess will definitely learn how this game is played instantly. The game is about moving red and blue knights over boards of chess to red/blue highlighted tiles, as in a game of chess, knights can only move in L-shaped direction (2 tiles straight and then 1 tile to side), the knights can jump over whatever it's standing in their way, as long as the tile they're meant to go to is empty. To clear a level, every red knight has to stand in a red tile, as well as every blue knight in blue tile (the easiest  levels only contain knights of 1 color). 

What to expect of the base game (level packs and levels):
There are 82 levels in the base part of the game total divided into 5 level packs - the pawn pack, the rook pack, the bishop pack, the queen pack and the king pack. With pawn being easiest to king being hardest, resembling to value of the chess figures (rook is easier than bishop). Why exactly 82 levels? It's rather simple, allow me to explain: Pawn pack is the easiest, the board sizes in pawn pack are 3x3 tiles, so 9 tiles total, there are 9 levels in the pawn pack. Rook is on 4x3 tile sized boards, meaning there are 12 tiles and levels. Bishop is 4x4 (16 levels), queen is 5x4 (20 levels) and king is 5x5 (25 levels).
If you struggle with one specific level, you can always skip it and return to it later or not return to it at all, as unlocking new pack doesn't require you to complete all levels in the pack you are in, only most of the levels in a pack have to be completed in order to unlock a next one.

Additional information about the levels:
But of course, to make every one of the levels unique and more and more challenging as the game gets harder, most of the levels have some tiles on the board blocked, meaning no knight figure can access them. Even later in the game (starting from queen pack), there will also be yellow knights. It doesn't matter where yellow knights stand at all. They are there just to make the game harder for you by blocking the red and blue knights resulting in more trouble of getting them to the highlighted tiles. Of course you can move the yellow knights, but also only in the L-shaped ways. You can reset and exit any level at any time, everything auto-saves.

Daily levels:
The game has also a feature that automatically generates completely random 75 levels you can play everyday, divided into 3 25-level packs. Pack A, B and C. Those packs reset daily and have no influence on the main packs that are the same forever.

Motivational words:
Upon pausing the game or finishing any of the main packs, you are given motivational texts, being reminded how capable you are, really nice little addition to the game.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Game's design:

Before launching the game, you'll see a small options window allowing you to set the graphic settings, the resolution of the game, and whether you want the game to be windowed or not. Even on the highest graphic settings and resolution, the game design is still so simple that every computer/laptop without exception could run it.

The music was great to the theme of the game. Simple and calming.

Overall the way the game looks is just the way a puzzle game like KNIGHTS should look like in my opinion.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Summary of pros & cons:

Pros:
-Great and challenging puzzles, over 3 hours of fun in levels of various difficulties
-Easy to run on any PC
-Nice base price of 0.99€, discounted to 0.49€ during sales
-Very easy to understand
-Ideal for people of all ages, from children to elders
-Great atmosphere of the game, relaxing music and fitting graphics
-Almost endless, considering there are 75 new levels automatically generated every day
-Great motivational texts 

Cons:
-Being a simple puzzle game could also make the game repetitive and boring for some people
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Final words:
I did not know what to expect of the game when I've been buying it for the discounted price of 0.49€, but after starting it, I could almost instantly tell the game is great. I got more addicted to it than I would expect and even though I'm generally not a big fan of puzzle games, I really couldn't help myself but to leave this one a positive review. Definitely worth buying even its full price, though waiting for a 50% discount can always work too. Since the game also drops trading cards, big % of the game's price will still return to you through selling the trading cards, even though the game itself is already pretty cheap. If you are a big fan of puzzle games, I'd suggest to give KNIGHTS a shot as soon as you're able to, I am pretty sure you won't regret it.

This is my second serious game review I've written on steam. Took over an hour to do. Leaving any feedback in the comments would be appreciated. Thank you for reading!

Милая, приятная и минималистическая игра, лишь частично чем-то напоминает старые, добрые шахматы. Правда от самих шахмат, нам остаётся только фигура коня. Главный принцип игры, это постоянно ходить [b]буквой "Г"[/b] для того, чтобы попасть красными и синими коняшками в соответствующие цветовые клетки. 
 Для тех кому нравятся разные логические игры, то эта игра несомненно найдёт приятный положительный отклик. 
 Ведь если по началу, все задания будут лёгкими, выполняемые несколькими кликами, то по мере продвижения вперёд, сложность будет усиливаться и на прохождение одной партии у вас спокойно может уйти десятки минут.
 В игре 5 левел глав, в котором будет непосредственно по 9, 12, 16, 20, 25 заданий. После того, как всё будет пройдено, на этом действия не заканчиваются и будет доступен ещё один важный игровой раздел: Daily.
 Включающий в себя по настоящему сложные 3 главы по 25 заданий, причём эти [b]75 заданий[/b], автоматически генерируются каждый день, а значит на выходе мы имеем нескончаемый поток логических партий.  
 Несомненным дополнительным плюсом игры, являются наличие карточек, достижений, а также шикарный, по настоящему монотонный, минималистический эмбиент в роле музыкального фона, который полностью позволяет расслабиться, но в то же время полноценно погрузиться эту головоломку и встряхнуть свои мозговые извилины.
 Игра своих денег однозначно стоит, даже без скидок, ибо стоит не так много, но только для тех ценителей, кто любит непринуждённый минимализм и решать небольшие логические задачки.

25386667.review:
KNIGHTS ist ein Knobelspiel, basierend auf der Schachfigur des Springers, oder wie andere sie nennen (Pferd, Reiter oder Ritter).

Es wird auf Schachfeldern verschiedener Größen gespielt, angefangen von 3x3, und steigert sich mit jedem Levelpack bis auf ein 5x5 Feld. Dabei muss man Springer auf die Zielfelder bewegen - in klassischer "2 Felder vor, eins zur Seite" Manier. Natürlich sind die Felder nicht leer - es gibt viele Hindernisse, und der Weg zum Ziel ist ein langer...

Der Schwierigkeitsgrad zieht allerdings gut an. In jedem Levelpack gibt es leichtere (A) bis Schwere (D) Levels. Zum Glück muss man nicht alle fürs Freischalten der nächsten Level lösen - manche sind bockschwer, und man denkt schon ein wenig nach...
Insgesamt gibt es 5 solcher Levelpacks, die unterschiedlich schnell zu lösen sind und die immer schwieriger sind.
Nachdem man alle gelöst hat, werden die täglichen Rätsel freigeschaltet, die gefühlt mal leichter, aber meistens schwerer sind.

Das Menü ist sehr übersichtlich, das Spiel läuft sehr flüssig und hat eine sehr gute Grafik.
Besonderes Lob erhält von mir die Musik, die nicht nur passend untermalt, sondern auch einen sehr beruhigenden und angenehm entspannden Touch hat.
Dadurch ist KNIGHTS ein ideales Spiel, um nach dem Arbeitstag abzuschalten.

Nun zu der Frage, die sich viele stellen:
Ist KNIGHTS 99 Cent wert?

Die Antwort lautet ja.
Es ist ein rundes, ruhiges Rätselspiel, das auf einem bekannten Prinzip (Schach) basiert, aber sich auf eigene Ideen verlässt.

Hinweis: Hin und wieder bekommt man Coupons für dieses Spiel auch bei der Abzeichenherstellung, dann kostet es nur noch 66 Cent.
Hier sollte man unbedingt zuschlagen!

[h1]Tricky Knights[/h1]

[b]Price: <$1.00USD[/b]

As a fan of both chess and puzzle games, this was a must buy. 

The design is simple, and gameplay easy to understand. Each new series starts out with a basic puzzle, and the difficulty builds as the player progresses.

Each minor variation makes a big difference. Whether the amount/placement of squares, the amount/placement of illegal squares, the amount/placement of pieces, the amount/placement of dummy knights, etc.

A cool addition would be a hardcore mode, or option to remove the preview of legal squares. Also an option to change theme(s).

One thing that became annoying was the looping music.

[b]Completion time: 6.7 hrs[/b]

~TLDR 
Pros: 
+Cost
+Casual play
+Daily puzzles
+Easy to learn
+Interesting concept
+Puzzles increase in difficulty
+Simple design
+Tricky knights

Cons
-Could use more content/options(fair for price)
-One looping song


Recommended?
[u]Yes[/u]

[h1] KNIGHTS[/h1]
难度适中的解谜益智小游戏

首先吸引我的是极简主义简约清新的艺术设计
色彩搭配让人很舒服
Arzola's工作室的标题页面也很漂亮

音乐音效没有很深的印象
但我在刷25日常解谜时心里也不厌烦
既没有一鸣惊人，也不会喧宾夺主，对于休闲解谜游戏来说恰到好处

玩法比较简单，把蓝马放进蓝格子里，红马放进红格子里，走法同国际象棋的马，同色马之间没有区别
前中期的游戏就能找到窍门，后面的关卡畅通无阻
[spoiler] 专注于处理某一个格（角落的优先），意图让对应色的马先落位
一步步推马要走的路径，直到某只马找到空位可以移动借位
如：A是决定处理的某个红格，B是到A的必经格（B上有蓝子），C和D格可跳至B，C上有红子，D上有蓝子，D连E，E连F，F连G，G连H，各空格上都有无关子，但H是空的。
则G→H，F→G，E→F，D→E，B→D，C→B→A[/spoiler]

推一下工作室首页，新作BALANCE正在策划
[url=http://heisarzola.com/KNIGHTS/] ARZOLA'S[/url]


最后扯点题外话，我竟在这小游戏里看到了点人生哲理的意味

我是红马，你是蓝马，我们都走日字
你站在我想要的红格，我站在你想要的蓝格，我们都急着想达到自己的目的
却不肯自己先退一步

我退一步，可以给你让出蓝格的空位
你进一步，达到了目的，我却不能再动
于是你往旁退了一步。我进两步达成，你回一步达成
如此两人都能到达目的地

琐事矛盾，先退一步，各退一步

[b] 千里修书只为墙
让他三尺又何妨
万里长城今犹在
不见当年秦始皇[/b]

Mal ein etwas anderes Knobelspiel - schlicht, aber sehr schön umgesetzt.

Die Spielmechanik ist simpel: Wie der Springer beim Schach können die Figuren nur in einer L-Form auf dem Spielbrett bewegt werden. Das klingt zunächst relativ einfach, und deswegen gibt es im Verlauf des Spiels immer mehr Hindernisse, damit das Ganze nicht langweilig wird.

Anfangs gibt es nur rote und blaue Figuren, die man auf bestimmte farblich markierte Felder bringen muss. Die ersten Level klickt man sich ziemlich schnell durch, und auch die ersten gesperrten Felder stellen noch keine große Herausforderung dar.
Dann aber sind immer mehr Felder gesperrt und schließlich tauchen auch noch gelbe Figuren auf, die zwar bewegt werden können, aber eben zusätzlich Felder blockieren. Es kann schon mal etwas kniffelig werden, sich dabei nicht selbst im Weg zu stehen.

Hat man alle Level durch, gibt es auch noch die zufälligen, täglichen Level, die man spielen kann. Einige Stunden Knobelei sind also durchaus drin.

Das Spiel hat mir ziemlichen Spaß gemacht, lief bugfrei und ist kostengünstig. Definitive Kaufempfehlung!

KNIGHTS:

To clarify KNIGHTS is not the most mentally strenuous puzzle game you could purchase, with many of the easier levels open to brute forcing and simply clicking many times to solve them. But in saying this there is a clear difficulty progression, with the game becoming noticeably more challenging on higher levels. The mechanics of the game are simple and easy to access, with only a single movement pattern to memorise, the game comes intuitivally to those who have played chess.

PROS:
*Easy to access game mechanics that are explained through gameply rather than through a boring, obsolete, unskippable cutscene
*Clear difficulty progression, the game gets more challenging the more you play
*Charming visuals and music that allow you to focus on the puzzle without feeling disengaged or being distracted by over the top music or graphics
*Large amount of content for the low price

CONS:
The game is very good and has a reasonable price so there are few major flaws, therefore these cons will consist of nitpicking.
*The blocked square tile could look different as at first it confused me why I could not move there.
*The ghost knights which show movment could be changed as they make the board look a little 'busy' and can be distracting

KNIGHTS is a great game and well worth the cheap price, I enjoyed it immensely and would most certainly recommend purchasing it.

No knowledge of chess required (but the checkboard pattern plays an important part in helping you figure out where to move / store pieces). I'm over halfway through after several days of off and on play, and haven't had to skip any boards yet. If you get stuck, just reset the board and start over, and you'll likely figure out the solution quickly. You can take as many turns as you want, there's no time penalty or move limit / counter. Ridiculously cheap. Bug free, and fully functional. Probably the best value on Steam that I've come across yet. I play this to mellow out after other games or situations leave me stressed and annoyed. If logic puzzles appeal to you in the slightest, buy this game, you won't regret it, I guarantee. 11 out of 10. Simple perfection.

No es mucho lo que se puede decir sobre este juego, es sencillo, pero a la vez totalmente disfrutable por los aficionados a los buenos Puzles.

Un excelente ejemplar, de que en las manos correctas, Unity puede hacer cosas grandiosas.

El trasfondo del título es muy sencillo, será necesario completar una serie de niveles cuyo orden puede ser elegido por el jugador para evitar trabas o malas experiencias debido a la frustración del escaso avance. Hay 5 grupos de niveles, el Peón, la Torre, el Arfil, la Reina y el Rey. Cada grupo posee una mayor dificultad.

• Gráficos: Los gráficos son en extremo sencillos, pero a la vez agradables y atractivos. Poseen un estilo similar al Material Design que tanto se ha masificado últimamente.

• Sonido: Este apartado es uno de los mejores, es envolvente y relajante, una tonada instrumental suave, perfecta para estimular las neuronas y lograr sortear los múltiples y difíciles niveles.

• Jugabilidad: Para los quienes ya hayan jugado ajedrez en algún momento, notaran que el movimiento del caballo es el mismo necesario para poner las piezas en el lugar adecuado. En caso contrario, el movimiento debe ser en forma de "L". Este apartado a su vez, está igual de bien trabajado que los demás, es sencillo aprender las mecánicas debido a su sencillez.

• Re-Jugabilidad: La misma no tiene mucho sentido tomando en cuenta que el titulo gira en torno a la misma mecánica. Aunque esto como siempre, queda a elección del jugador.

Es un juego muy bien trabajado, cuyos detractores deben ser buscados bajo un lente muy crítico, pero que para jugadores casuales, puede ser una estupenda experiencia.

Un pequeño consejo antes de terminar, la solución suele ser más simple de lo que imaginas.

Petit puzzle game vraiment très sympa et qui ne demande aucune connaissance en échec. L'objectif est de déplacer un ensemble de cavaliers (qui se déplacent en L) sur un échiquier jusqu'a réussir a les placer sur les bonnes cases. Le jeu commence assez simple avec peu de cavalier et des échiquier de taille 3x3 mais devient progressivement de plus en plus difficile avec de plus en plus de cavaliers et des échiquiers de plus en plus grand. Les niveaux les plus difficles demande pas mal de réflexion et de pouvoir planifier plusieurs coups à l'avance.

Comptez plusieurs heures pour finir tout les niveaux et même après les avoirs finis on peut débloquer les "daily challenge" qui génèrent des niveaux aléatoires tout les jours. Au final on a largement de quoi jouer jusqu'à ce qu'on se lasse du concept.

L'esthétique est très minimaliste et épuré ce qui est plutôt agréable pour ce genre de jeu même s'il faut un peit peu de temps pour s'habituer à l'échiquier à 45°.

Au final si vous cherchez un petit puzzle game pas cher, très facile à prendre en main mais avec une bonne difficulté progressive je recommande sans problème ce jeu.

P.S. le jeu est entièrement en anglais mais même si vous ne comprenez pas l'anglais vous devriez pouvoir prendre en main le jeu sans problème.

23317814.review:
My video review for this game:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SQpvsNkNfzk

KNIGHTS is an indie puzzle game built around the abilities of the knight from chess. While it looks like a chess game, it plays similar to a sliding puzzle in the sense that you make sequential moves and have to deal with spatial constraints.

The game features 82 levels, subdivided into 5 level packs: 
- Pawn: 9 levels
- Rook: 12 levels 
- Bishop: 16 levels 
- Queen: 20 levels 
- King: 25 levels 

It took me about 6 hours to unlock everything, at the time of writing this review I have access to the daily levels and I still have 23 King levels left to do.

A very nice feature of this game is the fact that it offers new levels daily, which are randomly generated. However, the daily puzzles are only unlocked after beating the Queen level pack, which is relatively late in the game. The reason for this is the introduction of yellow ''obstacle'' knights in the Queen levels. I think that the unlocking of daily puzzles should occur after completing a few Queen levels, and not the whole pack.

The UI is minimalistic, which is nice, but could do with a few extras such as a redo button or an overlay to make some notes or scribbles on. 

This is a nice puzzle game with a lot of playable levels and the price is fair. Absolutely a recommendation for anyone that is into puzzle games.

KNIGHTS to gra, na którą wpadłem całkowitym przypadkiem i muszę przyznać, że to jedno z moich przyjemniejszych zaskoczeń, jeżeli chodzi o takie niezależne gry w ostatnim czasie. 

Głównym elementem gry są figury Skoczków z szachów, i ich mechanika ruchu, tzw. L'ka. Poziom trudności gry rośnie w sposób zadowalający, a oprawa audiowizualna jest minimalistyczna i przyjemna. Idealna gra na wieczór, w tle, bądź w oderwaniu od czegoś większego. Relaksuje i sprawia naprawdę dużo frajdy. 

Dodatkowo, po ukończeniu gry można odblokować poziomy, które zmieniają się każdego dnia, podobnie jak w LYNE. Sprawia to, że gra absolutnie nie kończy się na jednym podejściu i można do niej swobodnie wracać.

Kolejnym atutem jest jej cena. Świetna i naprawdę oryginalna gra logiczna w cenie dwóch piw. Zdecydowanie polecam! Oby na Steamie było jak najwięcej właśnie takich indyków.

8+/10
